metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3141 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in r592_remove indrivers/memstick/host/r592.c in media access in the Linux Kernel. This flawallows a local attacker to crash the system at device disconnect, possiblyleading to a kernel information leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-27-generic - 6.2.0-27.28
linux-image-6.2.0-27-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-27.28
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-27-generic - 6.2.0-27.28
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-27-generic-64k - 6.2.0-27.28
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-kvm - 6.2.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1009-aws - 6.2.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1009-azure - 6.2.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-gcp - 6.2.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1007-ibm - 6.2.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1010.10
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1009-oracle - 6.2.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1010-raspi - 6.2.0-1010.12
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1002-starfive - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-27.28').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.10').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1009.9').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1011.11').
linux-ibm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1007.7').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.10').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1009.9').
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.12').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-starfive package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
